answers.answer: My sister-in-law lost her first son at 5months due to a genetic disorder so I have pretty much been freaking out my whole pregnancy even though the doctor tells me my baby boy is perfectly fine. Try not to worry a lot though you don't want stress on the baby. When I get to stressed about it I do yoga to calm myself down.

Thank you! I do some exercises also. It calms me down. Just so sad hearing their experiences. Of course I worry about it, but I have learned to not stress over it. God has a plan  for us all and it's in his hands.
Oh my yes I seen about someone losing there baby at 19 weeks but never 22 weeks or 5 months scares me I'm 20 weeks and I had a misscarige my first pregnancy but I wasn't that far into my pregnancy

question: I am 19+4. And I just read how someone at 19 weeks lost their baby and someone else at 22 weeks. Just has me so worried. My sister had preeclampsia and lost her son Saren 10 days after he was born. He was 4 1/2 months premature. It just scares me reading about women losing their babies so far into the pregnancy. Scary. Anyone else can relate to this worries feeling? Every time I have an ultrasound appointment I get really nervous hoping my little one is okay. It is devastating hearing these stories. :(
title: Losing your baby.
